message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SI

This paper discusses a network architecture to mitigate DDoS attacks on hybrid cloud environments. The primary focus of the paper is on network security, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) category. The paper also discusses the network architecture, which involves the integration of different networks, including cloud and on-premise networks, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of three-tier network architecture, which involves the use of different layers of network infrastructure, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) category. The paper also discusses the use of software-defined networking (SDN) and virtualization technologies, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning algorithms to detect and mitigate DDoS attacks, which suggests that it belongs to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) category.
